channel.title: Verizon's New Family Data Plans
channel.description:
Verizon's new family plans are good if you holding two line, but if you got five lines like me, am i better of switching to cricket?
Right now we pay $210, which includes: 1 smartphone, and 4 standard phones. They told me if I upgraded the other phones, the bill will jump up to [u]$350[/u]. They call it helping the customer save money. Honestly [u]$40 per phone[/u] and I got to buy data too! It would have been cool if it was $40 per phone and got unlimited data. Right now I pay $10 per phone, 30$ for the smartphone, $140 for 2100 minutes, unlimited text, weekend free and free talk to anywhere in the world.
[url=http://www.verizonwireless.com/b2c/plan-information/?page=share-everything]http://www.verizonwireless.com/b2c/plan-information/?page=share-everything[/url]

item.title: Verizon's New Family Data Plans
item.dc:creator: @Pwnd Pwnd
item.description:
@Pwnd wrote:

[quote=“R.I.P RSC, post:4, topic:457136”]$210 a month? I assume you mean 4 separate lines, all with their own phone number? We pay around €50 for digital TV, unlimited phone calls to all European home phones, and 50 Mbit internet.[/quote]Cell phones, not home phones…

Read full topic

item.title: Verizon's New Family Data Plans
item.dc:creator: @cooper cooper
item.description:
@cooper wrote:

Sprint has a promo going right now where if you switch, you get $400 instant savings. With a five line family plan, all smartphones, you would pay about 200ish a month, before any discounts, with unlimited data. With the $400 instant savings, you could get two S3s for free, or however you wanted to do it.

Read full topic
